attributes.action: introduce mandatory electrician licensing restrict sale of electrical materials
attributes.additional_details:
Electrical work in UK homes can currently be carried out by anyone, regardless of qualifications. Untrained individuals, handymen and kitchen fitters are able to buy electrical materials freely and perform electrical installations with no formal training, assessment or accountability.

Qualified electricians must complete years of training, hold the 18th Edition wiring regulations, maintain insurance, and undergo regular Competent Person Scheme assessments (NAPIT, NICEIC,
attributes.background: Introduce a national licensing system for electricians, require retailers to verify competency before selling key electrical materials, and strengthen enforcement of electrical safety regulations such as Part P.

rejection.details: Electric installation licence system & ban sale of materials to the unlicensed: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728785
